node.title: U.S. prime-time broadcast coverage on Thursday includes medal events in snowboarding halfpipe and Super-G.
node.alt: Shaun White at the qualification for the menâ€™s halfpipe this week. He is competing in his fifth and final Games.
node.description: Shaun White, on the halfpipe, and Mikaela Shiffrin, in Alpine skiing super-G, go for the gold.
node.content: ["The U.S. broadcast coverage of the 2022 Winter Games continues on Thursday with medal events in snowboarding halfpipe and Alpine skiing super-G, as the hockey and curling competitions advance and skeleton begins. All times are Eastern.", "SNOWBOARDING The three-time Olympic gold medalist Shaun White, who is competing in his fifth and final Games, will be in pursuit of gold once more in the men\u2019s snowboarding halfpipe final, airing live in prime time at 8:30 p.m. on NBC.", "SKELETON The women\u2019s event gets underway with the athletes\u2019 first runs, airing live at 8:30 p.m. on USA Network and featuring Kelly Curtis and Katie Uhlaender of the United States.", "ALPINE SKIING The two-time Olympic gold medalist Mikaela Shiffrin will compete in the women\u2019s super-G event, airing live at 10 p.m. on NBC and Peacock. Shiffrin will aim to be the first American woman to win a gold medal in the event since Picabo Street did so in 1998. Keely Cashman, Alix Wilkinson and Isabella Wright also compete for the United States.", "HOCKEY The U.S. women\u2019s team continues its defense of the 2018 gold medal as it plays the Czech Republic in the quarterfinals. The game will air live at 11:10 p.m. on NBC and USA Network. Denmark faces the Russian team in a preliminary game of the men\u2019s tournament live at 11:10 p.m. on CNBC.", "CURLING The U.S. men\u2019s team, skippered by the 2018 Olympic gold medalist John Shuster, faces Britain in pool play, airing live at 8:05 p.m. on CNBC and Peacock. The team has begun the Olympics with a 1-1 record, which includes a victory over Russia."]
